name: Grange City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1st Visit to hotel, stayed for two nights after boxing day, Hotel is very conveniently located, just two minutes from Towerhill tube station and 1 minute from Fenchurch Street Railway Station. On arrival reception staff was very helpful, and welcoming. Room was beautiful and very well furnished. We asked if we could extend our stay at the same rate, receptionist spoke to manager and immediately agreed even after the offer was no longer available. Breakfast was excellent. Overall hotel is very well staffed and not that expensive considering the location.
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In this hotel you wouldn't think you were in England - every single member of staff is foreign! A shame I think.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not a British member of staff in evidence anywhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: The information on the in-house TV screen was in incorrect English - they obviously couldn't even find a Brit to do that!!
reviews.title: A very nice Xmas stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2nd visit to hotel. stayed Xmas day and got a room upgrade. very nice room, lots of space. Big bed but the mattres was a little hard for our liking. Could see tower bridge (just) from our window. staff very helpfull. hotel bar good and not that expensive considering the location.
reviews.title: good night's stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: very close to DLR and tube station. also within a short walk of tower bridge and the tower of London. Would recommend
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here recently for my birthday, on a "Romance Package" booked by my boyfriend. I also recently stayed in the 5 star Corinthia hotel, so was expecting pretty much the same standard - how wrong was I!
reviews.title: Nowhere near a 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: The hotel is quite dated and has tired furniture. Our room was pleasant enough - we got upgraded to an executive room which had a view of the Tower of London, albeit an obscured one due to the office block next door. The room was large, as was the bed. However the furnishings were very old - the telephones looked like they were bought in 1985, and the overall decor of the room was not very modern. I didn't mind this too much as sometimes the most modern rooms arent necessarily the best.
reviews.title: Very nIce stay. Value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was quite nice, a Roman theme with a large pool great for swimming and small-ish steam/sauna rooms etc. I had a massage which was passable, although the masseuse was very friendly.
reviews.title: Be VERY careful booking this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our package included dinner in the restaurant. I know we went in Jan 2012 but this huge restaurant was absolutely deserted. The food was nice, but the service was terrible. Upon arrival we were asked if we wanted a bottle of water, yes we said - and 30mins later we were still waiting for it, gasping of thirst. Our bottle of wine after 40mins, and the starters about 50mins. Nearly an hour to wait for your wine and starter - not good.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: The breakfast was passable, again, nothing 5* about this for me. It was bog standard English breakfast made from bog standard quality food. I was still eating and had put my knife and fork down on my plate (apart), when a waiter proceeded to swipe it from underneath me! I had to explain I was still eating - this is simple table etiquette - you would think a waiter in a 5* hotel would understand a guest has not finished if her cutlery is sitting apart on her plate. Again - I kept comparing this with previous hotels. It just seems that the staff here do not have a clue.
reviews.title: £28 for two Gin & Tonics and a closed Sushi Restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have multiple stays at the Grange as it is located close to our office in London. This time I stayed 4 nights, including the weekend with my wife. It always takes some time to check in, but the receptionists were friendly and polite. But unfortunately I automatically answered yes when they asked if I had stayed with them before - and then you always get a much worse room than those who stay for the first time, All my colleagues and friends that have stayed at the Grange have experienced the same - a lovely room with a nice view the first stay, and then it goes down in standard.... This time I got a terrible half part of a syndicate room with a 1 meter view into a wall; I even heard everything that was said in the other part of the syndicate room - not very private.
reviews.title: Good location by the Tower, but rooms and service varies a lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked for a better room for the last two nights when my wife arrived to stay for the first time - and then I got a very nice room on 6th floor with a beautiful view of Tower of London and Tower Bridge. These rooms have a nice lounge, but extremely small bathrooms.
reviews.title: The rudest staff I've even seen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is average, with the option to get an omelet or fried egg at you own choice on weekdays. I was surprised to see that this option disappeared during weekends - why? It is at weekends you have time to enjoy a longer breakfast. The fresh fruit is very limited and not very exciting. The bacon must have been micro waved - unfortunately not very crispy or deliciously served.
reviews.title: Lovely Place, A Little Disappointed Though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The concierge staff wes very friendly and took good care of us as always!
reviews.title: excellent location, quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To conclude - a nice location at the edge of City, good potential with some very nice room that might be available to you if you ask for it or claim that it is your first stay. A little too pricy with regards to "value for money". Will return, but will remember to inform that it is my first time at the Grange!
reviews.title: a beautiful hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, very good hotel. Very good location, 2 min from the tube station, taxis are just outside.
reviews.title: One night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Swimming pool have lanes, and it was quite cold. Jacuzzi was cold, but good steam room and saunas. There is small good gym, restaurants in the hotel.
reviews.title: 30th birthday stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for the first time for my 30th birthday. Although we only stayed for one night, it was conveniently located to Tower Hill tube and to some nearby attractions (albeit that we both work within 5 minutes of the Hotel and knew this beforehand!).
reviews.title: lovely hotel
K. Mitchell
reviews.text: The Hotel was elegant and didn't appear to be particularly busy. Although the Hotel did not make our stay special (eg complimentary drinks/sparkling wine etc), we did enjoy a sizeable room on the 8th floor with a view of some landmarks on the River.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the continental breakfast was pricey (£22pp - though the room service menu looked reasonable), we did get a free Independent paper and made use of the efficient bellboy service to store our bag whilst we went sightseeing for the day.
reviews.title: Room upgraded on arrival, really nice stay throughout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel should have been really nice. Nicely decorated, great location and pleasant staff. Instead I had a horrible night.
reviews.title: Oh dear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival I was told I had received an upgrade to an executive room free of charge. Not a bad start I thought. So off I went to the annex and found room 110. Hardly executive. It was nicely furnished but the bed was very unusual to say the least. I seemed to have been pulled down from the wall. A kind of a " put you up " affair only a little more substantial, or so I thought.
reviews.title: Great location, service and view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internal walls were a weird kind of partition set up and the bathroom was tired.
reviews.title: Stunning!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, I retired to bed and was comfortable enough, until around 4am the matress and
reviews.title: Walking into another couples bedroom was interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I began to fall through a gap in the wooden slats. I sank and sank and sank. It was one of those sleepy moments went I thought to myself, this is a weird dream I'm having.
reviews.title: Great location. Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Grage City London hotel for one night while down in London on business. Checking in at 8pm after a long day at work was easy and pleasant, and my room on the 2nd floor was large, clean and very comfortable. Although my room window was around 50 yards from an overground train line I heard no noise during the night. Room service was delivered within 20 minutes and was delicious and reasonably priced from a modest menu. Free wi-fi was a nice bonus, and the satellite tv channels included Sky Sports - a rare treat! Checkout was handled with minimum fuss and all staff I met throughout my short stay were very courteous and professional.
reviews.title: Large rooms, pleasant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was in a fantastic location - 3 minutes walk from Tower Gateway DLR station and minutes from both Tower Bridge and the Tower of London.
reviews.title: Everything you need for a city break
Great location
reviews.text: I have stayed at a number of hotels during business trips to London and the Grange City is - so far- the best. I'd put it just above the Crowne Plaza.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a long weekend it is idealy situated opposite Tower of London next to tube station a couple of reasonably priced eateries walking distance.
reviews.title: Between Average and Good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Long queue at check inn on of the check in staff chose to ignore us we were passed over for wealthy looking clients. We were wearing trainers and carrying rucksacks we knew that we would be doing a lot of walking and preferred comfort. Eventually a nice male receptionist took pity on us and checked us in to an upgraded room with view of the Tower and Bridge.
reviews.title: Our second visit and still the same excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here earlier in the year and was disappointed as a hen party on the same floor totally rui9ned the trip. Not the hotels fault and so after some negotiation revisited with an upgrade. The hotel excelled themselves. Service / check-in / reception were all first class. Food at the restaurant was superb and not overpriced. Well done Grange !
reviews.title: Redeemed themselves !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was modern and spacious, the rate (through lastminute.com) was good - but the breakfast was dreadful! The buffet offered a desultory array with nothing cooked in front of you, so, for example, the fried eggs and scrambled eggs in the chafing dish looked tired, and the fruit juices didn't taste as though they'd seen fresh fruit in a long while. The price: a startling £23 whether you wanted just tea, toast and marmalade or something passing for a full breakfast, For a five-star hotel, this was the worst breakfast I've come across. A convenient hotel for the City - but skip the breakfast.
reviews.title: Skip the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Grange City Hotel as part of a weekend in London with my girlfriend. We originally booked a double room which was (i think called a superior). Trust me nothing about this room was superior - now you could blame me for booking one of the more basic rooms however when you consider this is a 5 star hotel in central London you would think that even the most basic room would be alright.
reviews.title: Bog Standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm going to be harsh to the hotel, but what i will say is that you don't want any of the basic double rooms. If you're going to go there, book one the larger better rooms (we got upgraded) which are far nicer.
reviews.title: nice but not sure what makes it a 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The accommodation was fine, clean, tidy - but small. The facilities were good but not sure what differentiates a 5* from a 4*. View of office block even though documentation promised a great view - to be fair we could just see the gherkin over the office block. Breakfast seemed to have a very limited selection. No English! The location of the hotel was excellent.
reviews.title: underwhelmed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A luxurious hotel very near Tower Bridge (which was handy as we were attending a wedding there). Very well appointed room, super comfy bed, two small sofas & coffee table, handy for eating our room service snacks. The pool and sauna were lovely, but disappointed the steam room was out of service. My partner used the gym, which was well equipped. We did have to ask house keeping for our robes, slippers & complementary water, which should have been in the room of a 5 star expensive hotel!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We didn't bother with breakfast at £26 per person.
reviews.title: not too bad but had better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: God hotel, nicely situated but I expected more for the money. Has a pool and spa but didn't get chance to use them. Bar is nice but service was quite rubbish, empty glasses and not asked if we wanted more. My room was tiny, hardly any space compared to staying at the premier inn round the corner for half the price and that room was huge!!! Staff were polite but certainly didn't put themselves out and I found them quite stern and unhelpful with an issue I had. I would stay here again but only if it was on offer and there was no where else available.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disappointed with this hotel. they said our room was an upgrade, the room was nice not but the view was terrible . We looked out over the hotel and fenchurch st station, which when there were announcement could be heard .
reviews.title: Would definitely book again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: On check in I was not asked for a copy of my credit card. This led to a number of problems. One ended with us getting a call when in bed after midnight asking us to come backdown and pay our meal bill. Their mistake as we had paid our bar bill and were led to believe it was on the room bill. They then came to the room twice as they made a mistake the first, but they could not wait till the morning.
reviews.title: Perfect London exploring base.

description: The Grange City Hotel is a spectacular luxury 5 star hotel. Superbly located with unique panoramic views over the City and just a gemstone's throw away from the Tower of London, the Grange City represents a first for a hotel of this standard in the City.
